titlestmt.titleproper: Conrich (Robert S.) Collection of Material Relating to the Incorporation of West Hollywood, Calif.
Finding Aid for the Robert S. Conrich Collection of Material Relating to the Incorporation of West Hollywood, California, 1980-1986 LSC.1520
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Genie Guerard, 2000.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

publicationstmt.p: Finding aid description and metadata in this record are licensed under a Creative Commons Public Domain Designation (CC0 1.0 Universal). See LSC's Metadata Rights Statement for more information.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2025-08-12 14:54:29 -0700.

did.unittitle: Robert S. Conrich collection of material relating to the Incorporation of West Hollywood, California
did.abstract: Robert S. Conrich was the host at the first meeting of the West Hollywood Incorporation Committee in August 1983, and he volunteered to work temporarily at City Hall after Hollywood achieved cityhood. He was the author of a weekly column on city issues with the Post Newspaper Group, questioning the policies of the new city government. The collection consists of files of Robert S. Conrich related to the founding and first years of the city of West Hollywood, California. Includes subjects and organizations such as animal control, the Brown Act, elections, Gay and Lesbian Association (GALA), homeless, housing, Neighborhood Action Groups (NAG), social services, transient occupancy tax, and unions.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: COLLECTION STORED OFF-SITE. Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.
Box 14 Folder 2 Closed until the year 2037 or donor's death, if before that date.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Robert S. Conrich Collection of Material Relating to the Incorporation of West Hollywood, California (Collection 1520). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Robert S. Conrich was the host at the first meeting of the West Hollywood Incorporation Committee in August 1983; volunteered to work temporarily at City Hall after Hollywood achieved cityhood; author of weekly column on city issues with the Post Newspaper Group, questioning the policies of the new city government.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of files of Robert S. Conrich related to the founding and first years of the city of West Hollywood, California. Includes subjects and organizations such as animal control, the Brown Act, building and safety rehabilitation, California Contract Cities Association, Christopher Street West, elections, Gay and Lesbian Association (GALA), homeless, housing, League of California Cities, Neighborhood Action Groups (NAG), social services, South Africa, transient occupancy tax, and unions.

controlaccess.subject: Municipal incorporation -- California -- West Hollywood -- Archives.

did.unittitle: Coalition for Economic Survival: FPPC (Fair Political Practices Commission).
Chamber of Commerce: West Hollywood area business directory.
Newspapers, publications, city publication information officer.
Organization charts, etc. - city rosters and lists.
Social services - seniors - ALA (Alternative Living for the Aging).
UCHDC (United Community and Housing Development Corporation).
West Hollywood for Good Government. Data processing report,

p.emph: There is no longer a Folder 1 in Box 14. Previous restriction was lifted and item was moved to Box 13 Folder 5.
Box 14 Folder 2 closed until 2037 or donor's death, if before that date.
